definitions: a definite or clear expression of something in speech or writing

examples.text: do you agree with this statement?
this is correct as a statement of fact

shortDefinitions: definite or clear expression of something in speech

definitions: an official account of facts, views, or plans, especially one for release to the media

examples.text: the officials issued a joint statement calling for negotiations

definitions: a formal account of events given by a witness, defendant, or other party to the police or in a court of law

examples.text: she made a statement to the police

shortDefinitions: formal account of events given by witness

definitions: an expression of an attitude or belief that is made by means of actions or appearance

examples.text: the hope is that they will fill the stands and terraces to make a statement about the importance of this club
a tattoo can be more than just a fashion statement–it has potential medical value

shortDefinitions: expression of attitude or belief made through actions or appearance

definitions: denoting something, such as a visually striking piece of jewelry, clothing, or interior decoration, that is intended to convey a particular attitude or image

examples.text: pure white walls and floors allow her statement furniture to take center stage
she accessorized with a dazzling orange scarf and a statement necklace

shortDefinitions: denoting something intended to convey particular attitude or image

definitions: a document setting out items of debit and credit between a bank or other organization and a customer.
shortDefinitions: document setting out items of debit and credit between bank or other organization

definitions: the expression of an idea or opinion through something other than words

examples.text: their humorous kitschiness makes a statement of serious wealth

shortDefinitions: expression of idea or opinion through something other than words

definitions: the occurrence of a musical idea or motive within a composition

examples.text: a carefully structured musical and dramatic progression from the first statement of this theme

shortDefinitions: occurrence of musical idea or motive within composition
